bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton, November 2, 1891
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, November 2, 1891
Mr Beverly Y. Payne, To the Department of State.
Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, November 2, 1891.
Hon., William F. Wharton, Acting Secretary of State Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully to acknwoeldge receipt of your Circular [SD, 8, '91 -1000] dated August 20, 1891, transmitting for my instruction and guidance a copy of an Executive Order, dated August 11, 1891, amending paragraph 664, of the Consular Regulations, relating to currency, evpies of the paragraph and certificate (from No 144) adapted to the new requirement, all being in
in suitable shape for paster to go in their proper places in the respectvie copies of the Consular Regulation: which have my attention, and will be observed.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obedient Servant,
Beverly Y. Payne, U.S. Vice Consul
